Moving RIGHT will take me away from any apples, causing a lapse before possibly turning DOWN to reach (2, 7). Instead, directly moving DOWN from my current position at (3, 5) is a more efficient move to get to the apple at (2, 7) in fewer turns. This path minimizes risk and time also considering the adversary's position and possible movements.

However, having reevaluated, I now see that moving DIRECTLY DOWN would bypass the apple, so moving LEFT first might help me position better for a speedier approach. By moving LEFT to (2, 5), I'm in a better spot to move DOWN to (2, 4) and then RIGHT to (2, 7) thereby claiming the apple faster and safer. I am aware of (2, 2) but decide on (2, 7) due to previous rationale about reaching and the pattern to capture easier points first.
